title: MuSiCNet: A Gradual Coarse-to-Fine Framework for Irregularly Sampled Multivariate Time Series Analysis
details: J Liu, M Cao, S Chen - arXiv preprint arXiv:2412.01063, 2024
abstract: Irregularly sampled multivariate time series (ISMTS) are prevalent in reality. Most existing methods treat ISMTS as synchronized regularly sampled time series with missing values, neglecting that the irregularities are primarily attributed to variations …

details: Y Choi, S Oh, JW Huh, HT Joo, H Lee, W You, C Bae… - Communications Medicine, 2024
abstract: Background Sepsis is one of the most life-threatening medical conditions. Therefore, many clinical trials have been conducted to identify optimal treatment strategies for sepsis. However, finding reliable strategies remains challenging due to limited-scale …

title: Robust Fine-tuning of Zero-shot Models via Variance Reduction
details: B Zhu, J Cui, H Zhang - arXiv preprint arXiv:2411.06966, 2024
abstract: When fine-tuning zero-shot models like CLIP, our desideratum is for the fine-tuned model to excel in both in-distribution (ID) and out-of-distribution (OOD). Recently, ensemble-based models (ESM) have been shown to offer significant robustness …

title: A residual GRU method with deep cross fusion for Alzheimer's disease progression prediction using missing variable-length time series data
details: N Jia, T Jia, Z Zhang - Biomedical Signal Processing and Control, 2025
abstract: Alzheimer's disease (AD) is a neurodegenerative disorder with a long prodromal phase. Early prediction of AD progression is crucial for improving clinical diagnosis. However, missing data and variable-length of time series data make it difficult to …
